intro: Astrantia caucasica, commonly known as Caucasian aster, is a perennial herb native to the Caucasus region. It features basal leaves that are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers with prominent central disks. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Astrantia caucasica is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
